messages.say:
File: Claude-SaaS Platform TypeScript Architecture.json

When you say seamless use of Google sheets and others you mean without the need of an extension , right?

No, that's not correct. Based on the code I implemented, the AI functions do require a Google Apps Script add-on extension to work within Google Sheets.


Here's what's actually needed:


Required: Google Apps Script Add-on


Users must install the AI Sheets add-on from Google Workspace Marketplace

The add-on contains the custom functions like =GPT(), =GPT_TRANSLATE(), etc.

Without the add-on, these functions simply won't exist in Google Sheets


How it works:


User installs the AI Sheets add-on

Add-on registers custom functions with Google Sheets

User can then type =GPT("prompt") directly in cells

The add-on intercepts these function calls and sends them to your AI Sheets API

Results are returned to the spreadsheet cell


Why an extension is necessary:


Google Sheets doesn't have built-in AI functions

Custom functions must be defined via Google Apps Script

The script needs to be packaged as an add-on for distribution

Users need to grant permissions for the add-on to make external API calls


Alternative approaches without extensions:


Web-based interface where users copy/paste data

Import/export via CSV files

Zapier integration for automation

Direct API calls (requires technical knowledge)


But for the seamless "use AI functions like Excel formulas" experience shown in the code, a Google Apps Script add-on extension is absolutely required. There's no way to inject custom functions into Google Sheets without going through Google's add-on system.
The extension need to exchange any data with the app on my main server

Yes, the Google Apps Script extension absolutely needs to exchange data with your main server. Here's the data flow:


Required Data Exchange:


Authentication Data:


User OAuth tokens or API keys

User identification and permissions

Space/team membership verification

Function Execution Data:


// Apps Script sends to your server:
{
  function: "gpt",
  input: "User's prompt from spreadsheet cell",
  options: { model: "gpt-4", temperature: 0.7 },
  metadata: {
    source: "google_apps_script",
    userEmail: "user@company.com",
    documentId: "spreadsheet_id"
  }
}

// Your server responds with:
{
  text: "AI-generated response",
  creditsUsed: 5,
  processingTime: 1200
}

Usage Tracking:


Credit consumption per function call

Rate limiting enforcement

Usage analytics and billing


Why Server Communication is Essential:


AI Processing: The add-on can't run AI models directly - it needs your server's API connections to OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.

Authentication: User permissions and space access are managed on your server

Billing: Credit tracking and usage limits are enforced server-side

Security: API keys for AI providers are stored securely on your server, not in the client-side add-on


Security Considerations:


The add-on will send potentially sensitive data from user spreadsheets to your server, so you need:


HTTPS encryption for all communications

Proper user authentication/authorization

Data privacy compliance (GDPR, etc.)

Audit logging of what data is processed


Alternative Architectures:


If you want to minimize server dependency, you could:


Let users input their own OpenAI/Anthropic API keys directly in the add-on

Process AI requests client-side (but this exposes API keys and has no usage controls)

Use a hybrid approach with local processing for simple functions


But for a production SaaS with billing, user management, and enterprise features, the add-on must communicate with your central server for every AI function call.
ok can you implement google extensions starting with sheets

manifest.json must be located in the root directory, that it defines metadata, resources, permissions, and behavior (background scripts, content scripts), and that Chrome extensions use standard web technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Reverse or delete the code for the extension. The add-on will be fine. Is there any files missing for the addon? Is there any tfiles required by Google that are missing too?

You're right - let's stick with the Google Apps Script add-on. Looking at what I've implemented, there are several missing files and Google requirements for a complete add-on:


Missing Required Files


Additional HTML interfaces:


batch-processor.html - Referenced in the main script but not created

welcome.html - First-time user onboarding

Error handling pages for authentication failures


Missing Google Apps Script functions:


processBatchFromUI() - Referenced in sidebar but not implemented

getUserSpaces() - For space selection in settings

switchSpace() - Space switching functionality


Required by Google for Marketplace


Essential for publication:


Code.gs ‚úì (implemented)

appsscript.json ‚úì (implemented)

HTML files ‚úì (mostly implemented)

Missing: Privacy Policy URL (required in manifest)

Missing: Terms of Service URL (required for marketplace)

Missing: Support/Help URL (required)


Google Apps Script specific requirements:


OAuth consent screen configuration (in Google Cloud Console)

Script properties for API endpoints (not hardcoded URLs)

Error logging integration with Google Cloud Logging

Proper version management in Apps Script


Marketplace submission requirements:


App icon (128x128 PNG for store listing)

Screenshots (showing the add-on in use)

Store listing description

Category and keywords

Target audience specification

Data usage disclosure


Security and compliance:


SSL certificate verification for API calls

Data retention policy documentation

GDPR compliance statements

Security assessment (required for sensitive scopes)


The core functionality is complete, but Google requires extensive documentation, compliance statements, and proper cloud project configuration before marketplace approval. Most critically missing are the privacy policy, terms of service, and proper OAuth consent screen setup.


Would you like me to implement the missing batch processor HTML file and the additional Apps Script functions, or focus on creating the compliance documentation templates?

Generate documentation, compliance statements, and proper cloud project configuration before marketplace approval. Most critically missing are the privacy policy, terms of service, and proper OAuth consent screen setup.

Privacy Policy for AI Sheets Add-on


# Privacy Policy - AI Sheets Add-on

**Effective Date:** [DATE]  
**Last Updated:** [DATE]

## 1. Introduction

This Privacy Policy describes how AI Sheets ("we," "our," or "us") collects, uses, and protects your personal information when you use the AI Sheets Google Workspace Add-on (the "Service").

## 2. Information We Collect

### 2.1 Information You Provide
- **Authentication Data:** Email address, name, and profile information from your Google account
- **API Keys:** Third-party AI service API keys you choose to store (encrypted)
- **Spreadsheet Content:** Text content from cells you process with AI functions
- **Configuration Settings:** Model preferences, temperature settings, and other customizations

### 2.2 Information Automatically Collected
- **Usage Data:** Function calls, processing times, error logs, and feature usage
- **Technical Data:** Browser type, add-on version, and anonymized performance metrics
- **Google Workspace Data:** Spreadsheet IDs (hashed), document names (hashed for analytics)

### 2.3 Information We Do NOT Collect
- Complete spreadsheet contents (only cells you actively process)
- Passwords or authentication credentials beyond OAuth tokens
- Personal files outside of active AI function usage
- Contact lists, calendar data, or other Google Workspace services

## 3. How We Use Your Information

### 3.1 Core Service Functionality
- Process AI requests for spreadsheet functions
- Authenticate and authorize your access
- Track usage for billing and quota management
- Provide customer support

### 3.2 Service Improvement
- Analyze usage patterns to improve functionality (anonymized)
- Monitor performance and reliability
- Develop new features based on user needs
- Ensure security and prevent abuse

### 3.3 Legal and Business Operations
- Comply with applicable laws and regulations
- Enforce our Terms of Service
- Respond to legal requests and prevent fraud

## 4. Information Sharing and Disclosure

### 4.1 Third-Party AI Services
We share your processed content with AI service providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google AI) as necessary to fulfill your requests. These providers have their own privacy policies governing data use.

### 4.2 Service Providers
We may share information with trusted service providers who assist with:
- Cloud infrastructure (Google Cloud Platform)
- Analytics and monitoring (anonymized data only)
- Customer support tools

### 4.3 Legal Requirements
We may disclose information when required by law, including:
- Valid legal process or government requests
- Protecting rights, property, or safety of users or others
- Business transfers (mergers, acquisitions, or asset sales)

### 4.4 What We DON'T Share
- Personal information for marketing purposes
- Individual usage data with third parties
- API keys or authentication credentials
- Complete spreadsheet contents

## 5. Data Security and Protection

### 5.1 Security Measures
- **Encryption:** All data transmitted using TLS 1.2+ encryption
- **API Keys:** Stored with AES-256 encryption
- **Access Controls:** Role-based access and multi-factor authentication for our systems
- **Regular Audits:** Security assessments and vulnerability testing

### 5.2 Data Retention
- **Active Data:** Retained while your account is active and for 30 days after
- **Usage Logs:** Anonymized metrics retained for up to 2 years for service improvement
- **Support Data:** Communication records kept for 3 years for legal compliance

### 5.3 Data Location
Data is processed and stored in Google Cloud Platform facilities in the United States, with backups in the European Union for redundancy.

## 6. Your Rights and Choices

### 6.1 Access and Control
- **Account Settings:** Modify preferences through the add-on interface
- **Data Export:** Request export of your usage data and settings
- **Account Deletion:** Remove your account and associated data

### 6.2 Communication Preferences
- Opt out of non-essential communications
- Choose frequency of usage notifications
- Disable certain analytics collection (may impact service functionality)

### 6.3 EU/UK Users (GDPR/UK GDPR)
You have additional rights including:
- Right to rectification of inaccurate data
- Right to erasure ("right to be forgotten")
- Right to data portability
- Right to object to processing
- Right to lodge complaints with supervisory authorities

## 7. Children's Privacy

The Service is not intended for users under 13 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13. If we become aware of such collection, we will delete the information immediately.

## 8. International Data Transfers

For users outside the United States, your information may be transferred to and processed in the United States. We implement appropriate safeguards including:
- Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) for EU data transfers
- Privacy Shield successor frameworks as available
- Adequacy decisions where applicable

## 9. Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy periodically. Material changes will be communicated through:
- In-app notifications within the add-on
- Email notifications to registered users
- Updates posted on our website

Continued use of the Service after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

## 10. Contact Information

### Data Protection Officer
For privacy-related questions or requests:
- **Email:** privacy@aisheets.com
- **Mail:** AI Sheets Privacy Team, [FULL ADDRESS]

### General Support
- **Email:** support@aisheets.com  
- **Website:** https://aisheets.com/support

### EU Representative (if applicable)
[EU REPRESENTATIVE CONTACT INFORMATION]

## 11. Additional Disclosures

### California Residents (CCPA)
Categories of personal information collected: Identifiers, commercial information, internet activity, and professional information. We do not sell personal information.

### Google API Services User Data Policy Compliance
Our use of information received from Google APIs adheres to the Google API Services User Data Policy, including the Limited Use requirements. We only request necessary scopes and use data solely for providing the Service functionality.

---

**Document Version:** 1.0  
**Effective Date:** [DATE]  
**Next Review Date:** [DATE + 1 YEAR]


Terms of Service for AI Sheets Add-on


# Terms of Service - AI Sheets Add-on

**Effective Date:** [DATE]  
**Last Updated:** [DATE]

## 1. Agreement to Terms

By installing, accessing, or using the AI Sheets Google Workspace Add-on (the "Service"), you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service ("Terms"). If you disagree with any part of these terms, you may not access the Service.

## 2. Description of Service

AI Sheets is a Google Workspace Add-on that provides artificial intelligence functions within Google Sheets, including:
- Text generation and editing using AI models
- Translation services
- Content classification and analysis  
- Data extraction and summarization
- Web search integration
- Batch processing capabilities

## 3. User Accounts and Authentication

### 3.1 Account Requirements
- You must have a valid Google Workspace account
- You must be at least 13 years of age
- You must provide accurate registration information
- You are responsible for maintaining account security

### 3.2 Authentication Methods
- Google OAuth (recommended)
- API key authentication
- You are responsible for protecting your credentials

### 3.3 Account Responsibilities
- Maintain confidentiality of authentication credentials
- Notify us immediately of unauthorized access
- Accept responsibility for all activities under your account

## 4. Acceptable Use Policy

### 4.1 Permitted Uses
- Process spreadsheet data for legitimate business purposes
- Generate content that complies with applicable laws
- Use AI functions for educational or research purposes
- Collaborate with team members within usage limits

### 4.2 Prohibited Uses
You may NOT use the Service to:
- Generate harmful, illegal, or offensive content
- Violate intellectual property rights
- Spread misinformation or engage in deceptive practices
- Attempt to reverse engineer or exploit the Service
- Exceed rate limits or circumvent usage restrictions
- Share accounts or authentication credentials
- Use for competitive analysis of our Service

### 4.3 Content Restrictions
- No personally identifiable information of third parties without consent
- No confidential or proprietary information belonging to others
- No content that violates export control laws
- Compliance with your organization's data policies

## 5. Pricing and Payment Terms

### 5.1 Pricing Structure
- Service operates on a credit-based system
- Credits are consumed per AI function call
- Pricing tiers available: Free, Starter, Professional, Enterprise
- Current pricing available at https://aisheets.com/pricing

### 5.2 Billing Terms
- Subscription fees billed monthly or annually
- Credits reset at the beginning of each billing cycle
- Overage charges apply per additional credits used
- All fees are non-refundable except as required by law

### 5.3 Payment Processing
- Payments processed through Stripe
- Valid payment method required for paid plans
- Automatic renewal unless cancelled
- Price changes with 30-day advance notice

## 6. Intellectual Property Rights

### 6.1 Service Ownership
- We retain all rights to the Service, including software, algorithms, and documentation
- These Terms grant you a limited, non-exclusive license to use the Service
- No rights granted except as explicitly stated herein

### 6.2 User Content
- You retain ownership of your original spreadsheet content
- You grant us limited rights to process content for Service delivery
- AI-generated content ownership governed by applicable AI provider terms
- You warrant you have rights to any content you process

### 6.3 Third-Party Integrations
- Google Workspace integration governed by Google's terms
- Third-party AI services (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.) subject to their terms
- You are responsible for compliance with all applicable third-party terms

## 7. Privacy and Data Protection

### 7.1 Data Processing
- Personal data processed according to our Privacy Policy
- We act as data processor for your spreadsheet content
- You remain data controller for your organization's data

### 7.2 Data Security
- Industry-standard security measures implemented
- No guarantee against unauthorized access or data breaches
- Incident notification procedures outlined in Privacy Policy

### 7.3 Data Retention
- Active data retained during account lifetime
- Deletion available upon account termination
- Some anonymized data retained for service improvement

## 8. Service Availability and Support

### 8.1 Service Level
- Service provided on "as available" basis
- No guarantee of uninterrupted access
- Planned maintenance with advance notice when possible

### 8.2 Support Services
- Documentation available at https://aisheets.com/docs
- Email support at support@aisheets.com
- Response times vary by subscription tier
- No telephone support provided

### 8.3 Service Modifications
- We reserve the right to modify or discontinue features
- Material changes communicated with advance notice
- Continued use constitutes acceptance of changes

## 9. Limitations of Liability

### 9.1 Disclaimer of Warranties
THE SERVICE IS PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT.

### 9.2 Limitation of Damages
TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, OUR LIABILITY SHALL NOT EXCEED THE AMOUNT YOU PAID FOR THE SERVICE IN THE 12 MONTHS PRECEDING THE CLAIM.

### 9.3 Exclusions
WE ARE NOT LIABLE FOR:
- Indirect, consequential, or punitive damages
- Loss of profits, data, or business opportunities
- Third-party actions or content
- Service interruptions or data breaches
- AI-generated content accuracy or appropriateness

## 10. Indemnification

You agree to indemnify and hold harmless AI Sheets from any claims, damages, or expenses arising from:
- Your use of the Service
- Violation of these Terms
- Infringement of third-party rights
- Your content or data processed through the Service

## 11. Termination

### 11.1 Termination by You
- Cancel subscription through account settings
- Termination effective at end of current billing period
- Data deletion available upon request

### 11.2 Termination by Us
We may suspend or terminate accounts for:
- Violation of these Terms
- Non-payment of fees
- Illegal or harmful activities
- Extended periods of inactivity

### 11.3 Effect of Termination
- Access to Service immediately revoked
- Outstanding fees remain due
- Data deletion according to retention policy
- Provisions surviving termination as applicable

## 12. Dispute Resolution

### 12.1 Governing Law
These Terms governed by the laws of [STATE/COUNTRY] without regard to conflict of law principles.

### 12.2 Arbitration Agreement
Disputes resolved through binding arbitration administered by [ARBITRATION ORGANIZATION] under their rules. Class action waiver applies.

### 12.3 Exceptions to Arbitration
- Small claims court matters
- Intellectual property disputes
- Injunctive relief requests

## 13. General Provisions

### 13.1 Entire Agreement
These Terms, together with our Privacy Policy, constitute the entire agreement between you and AI Sheets.

### 13.2 Severability
If any provision is found unenforceable, the remainder of these Terms remains in effect.

### 13.3 Assignment
You may not assign these Terms. We may assign without notice.

### 13.4 No Waiver
Failure to enforce any provision does not constitute a waiver of future enforcement.

### 13.5 Force Majeure
Neither party liable for delays caused by circumstances beyond reasonable control.

## 14. Contact Information

### Legal Notices
**AI Sheets Legal Team**  
[FULL LEGAL ADDRESS]  
Email: legal@aisheets.com

### General Support
**Email:** support@aisheets.com  
**Website:** https://aisheets.com/support

### Billing Questions
**Email:** billing@aisheets.com

---

**Document Version:** 1.0  
**Effective Date:** [DATE]  
**Next Review Date:** [DATE + 1 YEAR]

By using the AI Sheets Add-on, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service.


Now let me create the Google Cloud Project configuration guide:


Google Cloud OAuth Consent Screen Setup Guide


# Google Cloud OAuth Consent Screen Setup Guide

## Prerequisites

1. Google Cloud Project created
2. Google Apps Script project created and linked to Cloud Project
3. Domain ownership verification (for production)

## Step 1: Google Cloud Console Configuration

### 1.1 Enable Required APIs
Navigate to **APIs & Services > Library** and enable:

```
- Google Sheets API
- Google Drive API (if accessing files)
- Apps Script API
- Google Workspace Admin SDK (for domain-wide delegation)
```

### 1.2 Configure OAuth Consent Screen
Go to **APIs & Services > OAuth consent screen**

#### User Type Selection:
- **Internal:** For Google Workspace organizations only
- **External:** For public distribution (requires verification)

#### OAuth Consent Screen Configuration:

**Application Information:**
```
Application name: AI Sheets
User support email: support@aisheets.com
Developer contact information: developer@aisheets.com
```

**Application Domain:**
```
Application home page: https://aisheets.com
Application privacy policy: https://aisheets.com/privacy
Application terms of service: https://aisheets.com/terms
```

**Authorized Domains:**
```
aisheets.com
api.aisheets.com
```

**Application Logo:**
- Upload 120x120 pixel PNG logo
- Must be hosted on authorized domain

## Step 2: OAuth Scopes Configuration

### 2.1 Required Scopes
Add these scopes to your OAuth consent screen:

```
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spreadsheets.currentonly
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/script.container.ui
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/script.external_request
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.email
```

### 2.2 Scope Justifications
Provide clear justifications for each scope:

**spreadsheets.currentonly:**
```
Required to read cell content from the active spreadsheet 
for AI processing and to write AI-generated results back 
to cells. Only accesses the specific spreadsheet where 
the add-on is being used.
```

**script.container.ui:**
```
Required to display the add-on sidebar, dialogs, and 
user interface elements within Google Sheets. Essential 
for core add-on functionality.
```

**script.external_request:**
```
Required to make API calls to AI service providers 
(OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.) to process user content 
and return AI-generated responses.
```

**userinfo.email:**
```
Required for user authentication and to associate 
usage tracking with the correct user account for 
billing and quota management.
```

## Step 3: Apps Script Project Configuration

### 3.1 Link to Cloud Project
In your Apps Script project:
1. Go to **Project Settings**
2. Under "Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Project"
3. Enter your Cloud Project ID

### 3.2 Update appsscript.json
Ensure your manifest includes all required scopes:

```json
{
  "oauthScopes": [
    "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spreadsheets.currentonly",
    "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/script.container.ui", 
    "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/script.external_request",
    "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.email"
  ],
  "urlFetchWhitelist": [
    "https://api.aisheets.com/*",
    "https://api.openai.com/*",
    "https://api.anthropic.com/*"
  ]
}
```

## Step 4: Security Assessment (Required for Sensitive Scopes)

### 4.1 Prepare Security Assessment Documentation

**Application Architecture Diagram:**
- Data flow between Google Sheets, your add-on, and AI APIs
- Security boundaries and encryption points
- User authentication flow

**Security Measures Documentation:**
```
- TLS 1.2+ for all API communications
- OAuth 2.0 for user authentication
- No persistent storage of user data
- Minimal scope permissions requested
- Regular security audits and updates
```

**Data Handling Practices:**
```
- Only process user-selected cell content
- No access to full spreadsheet unless explicitly requested
- Temporary processing only - no long-term data storage
- User control over data sharing with AI providers
```

## Step 5: Domain Verification

### 5.1 Verify Domain Ownership
In Google Search Console:
1. Add and verify aisheets.com
2. Add DNS TXT record or HTML file verification
3. Confirm ownership status

### 5.2 Configure Domain Settings
```
Authorized JavaScript origins:
- https://aisheets.com
- https://api.aisheets.com

Authorized redirect URIs:
- https://api.aisheets.com/auth/google/callback
- https://aisheets.com/auth/success
```

## Step 6: OAuth Client Configuration

### 6.1 Create OAuth 2.0 Client ID
Go to **APIs & Services > Credentials**

**Application Type:** Web application

**Name:** AI Sheets Add-on

**Authorized JavaScript origins:**
```
https://aisheets.com
https://api.aisheets.com
```

**Authorized redirect URIs:**
```
https://api.aisheets.com/api/auth/google/callback
https://aisheets.com/auth/callback
https://script.google.com/macros/
```

### 6.2 Save Client Credentials
Store securely:
- Client ID
- Client Secret
- Use in your backend authentication flow

## Step 7: Testing Configuration

### 7.1 Test OAuth Flow
```javascript
// Test authentication in Apps Script
function testAuth() {
  try {
    const user = Session.getActiveUser();
    console.log('Authenticated user:', user.getEmail());
    return true;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Auth test failed:', error);
    return false;
  }
}
```

### 7.2 Test API Scopes
```javascript
// Test Sheets API access
function testSheetsAccess() {
  try {
    const sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSheet();
    const range = sheet.getRange('A1');
    console.log('Sheets access successful');
    return true;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Sheets access failed:', error);
    return false;
  }
}
```

### 7.3 Test External Requests
```javascript
// Test external API calls
function testExternalAPI() {
  try {
    const response = UrlFetchApp.fetch('https://api.aisheets.com/test');
    console.log('External API access successful');
    return true;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('External API failed:', error);
    return false;
  }
}
```

## Step 8: Production Readiness Checklist

### 8.1 Required Documentation
- [ ] Privacy Policy published and accessible
- [ ] Terms of Service published and accessible  
- [ ] Data usage and retention policy documented
- [ ] Security measures documented
- [ ] Contact information and support channels

### 8.2 OAuth Consent Screen Review
- [ ] All required fields completed
- [ ] Scopes justified with clear explanations
- [ ] Domain verification completed
- [ ] Logo and branding assets uploaded
- [ ] Test users added for initial testing

### 8.3 Google Apps Script Preparation
- [ ] Apps Script linked to Cloud Project
- [ ] All required scopes declared in manifest
- [ ] URL fetch whitelist configured
- [ ] Error handling implemented
- [ ] Logging and monitoring configured

### 8.4 Security Assessment Submission
- [ ] Application architecture documented
- [ ] Security measures detailed
- [ ] Data handling practices explained
- [ ] Vulnerability assessment completed
- [ ] Compliance documentation prepared

## Step 9: Marketplace Submission

### 9.1 Google Workspace Marketplace
1. Go to Google Cloud Console > Google Workspace Marketplace SDK
2. Complete store listing:
   - App name and description
   - Screenshots and promotional images
   - Category and target audience
   - Pricing information
   - Support and contact details

### 9.2 Review Process Timeline
- **Initial Review:** 2-4 weeks
- **Security Assessment:** 4-8 weeks (for sensitive scopes)
- **Policy Compliance:** 1-2 weeks
- **Final Approval:** 1-2 weeks

### 9.3 Common Rejection Reasons
- Incomplete or unclear scope justifications
- Missing or inadequate privacy policy
- Insufficient security documentation
- Non-functional OAuth flow during testing
- Violation of Google API policies

## Troubleshooting Common Issues

### OAuth Consent Screen Errors
```
Error: "redirect_uri_mismatch"
Solution: Verify all redirect URIs match exactly in OAuth client configuration

Error: "access_denied" 
Solution: Check that all required scopes are properly configured

Error: "invalid_scope"
Solution: Ensure scopes in Apps Script match OAuth consent screen
```

### Apps Script Integration Issues
```
Error: "Unauthorized" on external API calls
Solution: Verify URL is in urlFetchWhitelist in appsscript.json

Error: "Insufficient permissions"
Solution: Check that user has granted all required OAuth scopes
```

This configuration ensures compliance with Google's security requirements and prepares your add-on for successful marketplace approval.


Now let me create compliance documentation and data usage disclosure:


Compliance & Data Usage Disclosure


# Compliance & Data Usage Disclosure
## AI Sheets Google Workspace Add-on

### Data Usage and Retention Policy

#### Data Types Processed
The AI Sheets add-on processes the following types of data:

**User-Provided Content:**
- Spreadsheet cell content explicitly selected for AI processing
- Authentication information (email address, name from Google profile)
- Configuration preferences and settings
- Optional API keys for third-party AI services (stored encrypted)

**System-Generated Data:**
- Usage analytics (function calls, processing times, error rates)
- Performance metrics for service optimization
- Anonymized usage patterns for feature development

#### Data Retention Periods

| Data Type | Retention Period | Purpose |
|-----------|------------------|---------|
| Active user content | During session only | AI processing |
| Usage logs | 30 days | Support and debugging |
| Aggregated analytics | 24 months | Service improvement |
| Account settings | Until account deletion | User preferences |
| Support communications | 36 months | Legal compliance |

#### Data Processing Locations
- **Primary:** Google Cloud Platform (United States)
- **Backup:** Google Cloud Platform (European Union)
- **AI Processing:** Third-party providers (OpenAI, Anthropic) per their data policies

### GDPR Compliance Statement

AI Sheets complies with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and provides the following rights to EU users:

#### Legal Basis for Processing
- **Consent:** User explicitly agrees to process spreadsheet content
- **Contract:** Necessary for providing the requested AI services
- **Legitimate Interest:** Service improvement and fraud prevention

#### Data Subject Rights
- **Access:** Request copy of personal data we hold
- **Rectification:** Correct inaccurate or incomplete data
- **Erasure:** Request deletion of personal data
- **Portability:** Receive data in machine-readable format
- **Objection:** Object to processing for direct marketing
- **Restriction:** Limit processing under certain circumstances

#### Contact for GDPR Requests
**Data Protection Officer:** gdpr@aisheets.com
**Response Time:** Within 30 days of receipt

### Google API Services User Data Policy Compliance

#### Limited Use Commitment
AI Sheets' use of information received from Google APIs adheres to [Google API Services User Data Policy](https://developers.google.com/terms/api-services-user-data-policy), including the Limited Use requirements.

#### Data Usage Restrictions
We will only use Google user data to:
- Provide or improve AI Sheets features explicitly requested by users
- Comply with applicable laws and legal processes
- Ensure security and prevent fraud

#### Prohibited Uses
We will NOT use Google user data for:
- Serving advertisements
- Facilitating political campaigning or lobbying
- Training AI/ML models outside of direct service provision
- Any use not directly related to AI Sheets functionality

#### Third-Party Data Sharing
Google user data is only shared with:
- AI service providers (OpenAI, Anthropic) as necessary for processing
- Cloud service providers under data processing agreements

### Security Assessment Documentation

#### Security Architecture

**Data Flow Security:**
```
User Input ‚Üí TLS 1.2+ ‚Üí Google Apps Script ‚Üí TLS 1.2+ ‚Üí AI Sheets API

API Response ‚Üê TLS 1.2+ ‚Üê AI Provider ‚Üê TLS 1.2+ ‚Üê Processing Service
```

**Authentication & Authorization:**
- OAuth 2.0 with PKCE for user authentication
- JWT tokens with 1-hour expiration
- Role-based access control (RBAC)

**Data Protection Measures:**
- AES-256 encryption for stored API keys
- TLS 1.2+ for all data transmission
- No persistent storage of processed content
- Regular security audits and penetration testing

- **Automated Scanning:** Daily vulnerability scans

- **Security Training:** Annual training for all developers

- **Principle of Least Privilege:** Minimal necessary permissions
- **Regular Access Reviews:** Quarterly access audits
- **Logging and Monitoring:** All access attempts logged

### Content Policy and Moderation

#### Acceptable Use Policy
Users must not use AI Sheets to generate:
- Harmful, illegal, or offensive content
- Content that violates intellectual property rights
- Misinformation or deliberately deceptive content
- Content that violates third-party rights or privacy

#### Content Moderation
- **Automated Filtering:** AI-powered content screening
- **Manual Review:** Flagged content reviewed within 24 hours
- **User Reporting:** Easy reporting mechanism for policy violations
- **Appeals Process:** 7-day window for content removal appeals

#### Enforcement Actions
- **Warning:** First violation results in user warning
- **Suspension:** Repeated violations lead to temporary suspension
- **Termination:** Serious violations result in account termination
- **Legal Action:** Criminal activity reported to authorities

#### WCAG 2.1 AA Compliance
- **Keyboard Navigation:** All functions accessible via keyboard
- **Screen Reader Support:** Compatible with JAWS, NVDA, VoiceOver
- **Color Contrast:** Minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio maintained
- **Text Alternatives:** Alt text for all images and icons

- **High Contrast Mode:** Support for system high contrast settings
- **Text Scaling:** Compatible with browser zoom up to 200%
- **Voice Control:** Compatible with Dragon NaturallySpeaking

- **P0 (Critical):** Data breach, service-wide outage
- **P1 (High):** Significant security vulnerability discovered
- **P2 (Medium):** Limited security issue or privacy concern
- **P3 (Low):** Minor security or privacy improvement needed

#### Response Timeline
- **P0:** Immediate response (within 1 hour)
- **P1:** Response within 4 hours
- **P2:** Response within 24 hours
- **P3:** Response within 72 hours

## OAuth Scopes and Justifications

### Required Scopes
```
https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spreadsheets.currentonly
Justification: Read cell content for AI processing and write AI-generated results back to spreadsheet cells. Only accesses the active spreadsheet where the add-on is being used.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/script.container.ui  
Justification: Display add-on sidebar, dialogs, and user interface elements within Google Sheets. Essential for all add-on functionality and user interaction.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/script.external_request
Justification: Make API calls to AI service providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.) to process user content and return AI-generated responses. Core functionality requirement.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.email
Justification: User authentication and associating usage tracking with correct user account for billing, quota management, and personalized settings.
```

### Data Usage Policy Compliance
```
Limited Use: All user data used only for explicitly requested AI processing
No Advertisements: No user data used for advertising purposes  
No Human Review: Automated processing only, no manual review of user content
Secure Transfer: All data encrypted in transit using TLS 1.2+
Minimal Storage: User content not stored beyond processing session
```

can I host these on github?

You can host the documentation files on GitHub, but there are important considerations about what should and shouldn't be public:


Safe to Host Publicly on GitHub


Legal Documents:


Privacy Policy

Terms of Service

Compliance Documentation

OAuth Setup Guide

Marketplace Listing Configuration


These are meant to be public-facing documents that users need to access.


Should NOT Host on GitHub


Sensitive Configuration:


Actual OAuth client IDs and secrets

API keys or authentication tokens

Internal system URLs or endpoints

Database connection strings

Private security assessment details


Recommended GitHub Structure


ai-sheets-legal/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ docs/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ privacy-policy.md
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ terms-of-service.md
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ compliance.md
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ setup-guides/

‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ LICENSE


Important Considerations


URL Requirements:
Google requires stable URLs for privacy policy and terms of service. If hosting on GitHub Pages, use a custom domain like legal.aisheets.com rather than username.github.io/repo to avoid issues if you need to move the documents later.


Legal Validity:
While GitHub can host the documents, you should also serve them from your main domain (aisheets.com/privacy) as that's what users expect and what you'll reference in OAuth configurations.


Version Control Benefits:
GitHub provides excellent version tracking for legal documents, showing exactly when terms changed - which is valuable for compliance and transparency.


Access Control:
Keep any implementation guides or internal processes in private repositories, only making the public-facing legal documents available publicly.


The safest approach is hosting public legal documents on GitHub for transparency while keeping all actual configuration values and sensitive setup information in private repositories or secure configuration management systems.
